articles.content: It opened its doors to the public in October 1939 as Singaporeâ€™s first air-conditioned cinema. The Business Times traces Cathayâ€™s storied history:. Malaysian business magnate Loke Wan Tho built up Cathay Organisation and established Cathay Cinema. The Cathay Building at 2 Handy Road was Singaporeâ€™s first skyscraper. 1942-1945: During the Japanese Occupation, it housed the Japanese broadcasting department, military propaganda department and military information bureau. February 1949: Associated Theatres regained control of the building after the government vacated it. Cathay opened Singaporeâ€™s first drive-in cinema in Jurong. 1999: Cathay Organisation listed on the Singapore Stock Exchange. It was later delisted in 2006. The move was part of cost rationalisation for its cinema operations, said mm2 Asia
